alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 11:12PM EDT until April 13 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Rocky River and associated tributaries, as well as nearby low-lying areas and flood-prone locations, is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 PM EDT, National Weather Service gauge reports indicate a water level approaching 16.5 along the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek. At this level, Pharr Mill Road between Rocky River Road and Sequoia Hill Road may be submerged by up to 1 foot of water. Floodwaters may approach Stallings Road and Mount Pleasant Road. - At 17 feet, flood waters may cover Stallings Road and approach Poplar Tent Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant and Charlotte Motor Speedway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
